lead_paragraph: To the Editor: William Safire (column, March 1) seems perplexed that American taxpayers do not ''revolt'' over the budget surplus. This is hardly perplexing, especially to Californians. We had a ''taxpayer revolt'' in 1978, when the state was running a budget surplus.
abstract: Joseph W Doherty letter on handling of Federal budget surplus; points to detrimental effects that California's 'taxpaper result' had for schools and other services
